intro: Taraxacum himalaicum, commonly known as the Himalayan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers. The plant produces a distinctive seed head with white, feathery seeds that are easily dispersed by the wind. Its leaves are basal, alternate, and typically have a rough, hairy texture. Taraxacum himalaicum is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas at high altitudes.
